intro: Tylostemon letestui, commonly known as the New Caledonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Tylostemon letestui is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
